heroIntro: This exceptional 4-bedroom villa in Maryvilla represents a distinguished opportunity for discerning buyers seeking premium properties on the Costa Blanca. Located in Calpe, one of Spain's most prestigious coastal municipalities, this villa commands attention through its sophisticated design and substantial built area of 427m². Priced at €1,550,000, this property offers remarkable value at €3,630/m² - substantially below comparable developments in neighbouring Jávea and reflecting exceptional specification standards. The exclusive location within Maryvilla provides the privacy and prestige expected by luxury buyers, while Calpe's thriving international community and world-class amenities ensure a refined lifestyle. With 41 professional images documenting every aspect, this villa represents a significant asset in one of the Mediterranean's most sought-after markets, currently experiencing 7% year-on-year appreciation.
areaSection: Calpe, positioned on the northern Costa Blanca, is distinguished by its dramatic geography dominated by Peñón de Ifach, an iconic limestone monolith rising 332 metres above the Mediterranean. This natural landmark defines the region's character and provides stunning visual focal points throughout the town. The municipality benefits from exceptional climate conditions with over 300 days of annual sunshine, mild winters averaging 12°C, and refreshing sea breezes moderating summer temperatures. Calpe's strategic location between Valencia (120km north) and Alicante (70km south) offers excellent connectivity while maintaining its exclusive, quieter atmosphere compared to busier resorts. The town has evolved from a fishing village into a sophisticated Mediterranean destination, attracting affluent European residents who appreciate its perfect balance of coastal beauty, cultural heritage, and modern infrastructure.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Calpe revolves around sophisticated Mediterranean living standards rarely found in other Costa Blanca locations. The thriving expat community, particularly strong among British and German residents, has established a refined cultural landscape with excellent restaurants ranging from traditional Spanish establishments to Michelin-recommended venues. The weekly markets offer premium produce and local specialities, while three supermarket chains serve daily needs with international selections. Healthcare is exceptionally accessible through private clinics with English-speaking staff and proximity to Hospital de Dénia for specialist care. Leisure pursuits are abundant: five beautiful beaches within minutes, championship golf courses at Club de Golf Ifach and Don Cayo, and water sports facilities attracting international participants. The town centre maintains authentic Spanish character with galleries, boutiques, and traditional tapas bars, while English is widely spoken in tourist areas, creating seamless integration for international buyers.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment within the Costa Blanca's accelerating property market, with annual appreciation rates of 7% year-on-year establishing strong capital growth potential. The €1,550,000 acquisition price equates to €3,630/m², positioning this property substantially below Jávea comparables while exceeding average Calpe valuations of €2,600/m², reflecting premium specification. Rental market analysis indicates typical weekly rates of €1,000 for properties of this calibre, generating approximately €52,000 annual rental income - a 3.4% yield on purchase price before expenses. Calpe's established international residential community and consistent tourist demand support reliable long-term rental performance. The property's location in an increasingly popular municipality, combined with limited new development approval, suggests continued appreciation potential for discerning investors seeking Mediterranean real estate with both lifestyle benefits and financial returns.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in Maryvilla represents a distinguished acquisition opportunity for sophisticated buyers seeking premium Mediterranean real estate with demonstrated investment potential. The combination of superior specification, exclusive location, and established lifestyle amenities creates an uncompromising ownership experience balancing capital appreciation with genuine quality of life improvements. Calpe's thriving international community, exceptional healthcare standards, and sophisticated leisure facilities ensure long-term satisfaction beyond financial returns. The 41 professional images provide comprehensive documentation of every architectural element, while the strategic pricing of €1,550,000 reflects exceptional value within the current market. healthcare.text: Healthcare provision in Calpe exceeds typical coastal town standards, with a modern Centro de Salud Calp providing primary care and emergency services within the municipality. Private clinics throughout the region employ English-speaking medical professionals, essential for international residents requiring immediate consultation. Hospital de Dénia, approximately 30 minutes distant, provides comprehensive specialist services and surgical facilities meeting European standards. Dentistry, ophthalmology, and dermatology services maintain international-standard practitioners catering to expat populations. Prescription medications are readily available through numerous pharmacies, with pharmaceutical costs significantly lower than northern European equivalents.

education.text: Educational options range from Spanish state schools to prestigious international institutions, accommodating families seeking English-medium or dual-curriculum education. Laude Newton College provides comprehensive English-language education with university preparation programmes within 35 minutes. These institutions attract expatriate families and serve as community hubs for international residents establishing social networks and support systems.

transport.text: Transportation connectivity balances accessibility with the privacy of rural location. Alicante-Elche Airport, 70 kilometres distant, provides international flight connections to major European cities with journey times under 90 minutes. Local bus services connect Calpe to Benidorm and Valencia for regional travel. The imminent arrival of the TRAM system will dramatically enhance public transport connectivity, reducing journey times to Valencia. Private vehicle ownership remains practical for daily activities, with excellent road infrastructure and abundant parking throughout the municipality. The strategic location provides motorway access within minutes for exploring the broader Costa Blanca region.

faqs.question: What is the property tax situation in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spanish property taxes include IBI (annual council tax approximately 0.4-1.1% of property value) and annual wealth tax on properties exceeding €600,000 threshold. Rental income taxation applies standard rates. Professional property advisors and accountants specialising in expatriate taxation provide essential guidance optimising tax efficiency for international buyers, highly recommended during purchase consultation.

faqs.question: Is English widely spoken in Calpe?
faqs.answer: English is extensively spoken throughout Calpe, particularly in tourism areas, restaurants, healthcare facilities, and among the substantial expatriate community. This linguistic accessibility eliminates integration barriers for British, German, and other English-speaking residents, though learning basic Spanish enhances community engagement and cultural appreciation during extended residence.
